subject: Law
title: The Twenty-Sixth Amendment: Vote at 18
description: One-minute skill: The Twenty-Sixth Amendment: Vote at 18.

hook.text: Young men were drafted to fight in Vietnam at 18 but couldn't vote until 21. The contradiction was impossible to ignore.

buildup.text: 'Old enough to fight, old enough to vote' became a rallying cry during the anti-war movement.

discovery.text: The Twenty-Sixth Amendment (1971) lowered the voting age to 18 nationwide. It was ratified in record time.

twist.text: Despite the new right, youth voter turnout has historically remained the lowest of any age group.

climax.text: The amendment expanded democracy to millions, but exercising the right requires showing up.

punchline.text: Having the right to vote is step one. Using it is everything.

quiz.question: What prompted the Twenty-Sixth Amendment?
options: Young people being drafted but unable to vote
